data.title: Who is Caroline Wozniacki's NBA star husband David Lee, and when did defending Australian Open champion split up with Rory McIlroy?
meta_keywords: Who is Caroline Wozniacki's NBA star fiance David Lee and when did defending Australian Open champion split up with Rory McIlroy?
data.meta_description: Who is Caroline Wozniacki's NBA star fiance David Lee and when did defending Australian Open champion split up with Rory McIlroy?
data.text:
CAROLINE WOZNIACKI returns to tennis action against Sara Sorribes Tormo in the first round of Wimbledon.

The Dane does not have the best record at SW19, having never gone beyond the fourth round - but will hope her recent nuptials inspires her to success.

Who is her hsuband?

WOZNIACKI is married to ex-NBA player David Lee.

She announced on her social media account that they were together on Valentine's Day in 2017.

The couple got engaged in November last year whilst on holiday in Bora Bora, before their glitzy wedding in Tuscany earlier this month.

Why is David Lee famous?

DAVID Lee, who supported her at the Australian Open, is a former NBA All-star and winner of the NBA Championship.

Lee won the NBA Championship in his final season with Golden State Warriors in 2015 and announced his retirement shortly after the pair got engaged.

Was she was engaged to Rory McIlroy?

THE couple were together between 2011 and 2014 after bonding over their sporting lifestyles.

The pair were regularly seen together with Wozniacki acting as his caddie in a par-three competition on the eve of the Masters in 2013

McIlroy announced on New Year's Eve the same year that the pair had got engaged.

How did their relationship end?

McILROY ended the relationship in 2014, just days after their wedding invitations had been sent out with rumours that she had become a "bridezilla."

The break-up took place over the phone - something which Wozniacki has since admitted she found hard.

In his statement he said, "The wedding invitations made me realise that I wasn't ready for all that marriage entails.

"I wish Caroline all the happiness she deserves and thank her for the great times we've had.‚Äù
